argumentText:
Suppose an algorithm needs $n$ operations to compute the result. With 1
processor, the algorithm will take $n$ time units. With $N$ processors,
the $(1-f)n$ parallelizable operations will take $\frac{(1-f)n}{N}$ time
units and the remaining $fn$ non parallelizable operations will take
$fn$ time units for a total running time of $fn+\frac{(1-f)n}{N}$ time
units. So the speedup $S$ is
$\frac{n}{fn+\frac{(1-f)n}{N}}=\frac{1}{f+\frac{1-f}{N}}$.
